Topic.Title: Explain the love for AMZN to me

Message.Msg: That's a good explanation. But at the end of the day they are still just a retail store, which has traditionally low margins. And of course, when you stop building fulfillment centers... well that's the same time your growth stops. So you have a low margin business that's done growing which becomes a sub 10 PE company. So you're looking at $75/share at that point.

Message.Title: amzn will be larger than walmart
Message.Msg: I haven't been able to embrace Amzn until recently noticing the shopping habits of friends and family members over the last 6 months. The UPS truck is literally at our house daily - no more trips to Target. After taking an informal survey of friends and family members, it appears my household is not alone in this. I haven't been able to embrace Amazon as viable long term investment, but am increasingly becoming convinced Amazon will overtake Walmart as worlds largest retailer in coming years. Just recently purchased and initial position and will buy more on dips.

Topic.Title: amzn will be larger than walmart

Message.Msg: The problem for Amazon is that they lose money on their direct retail business (including prime) - go read Santos or Phillips at Seeking Alpha. The bigger it gets the more they lose. They make money on third party transactions and AWS only.
